full_title_en: TNM Staging for Breast Cancer (8th Edition)
medium_description_en: Stages breast cancer based on tumor, lymph nodes, and metastases (recommended as of 2017).
short_description_en: Breast CA staging, recommended as of 2017.

seo.meta_description_en: The TNM Staging for Breast Cancer (2017) stages breast cancer based on tumor, lymph node, and metastasis characteristics.
seo.keywords_en: 8 edition, 8th edition, tnm, breast ca, breast cancer, ductal breast CA, situ, lobular breast ca, breast tumor, breast lymph, breast mets, breast metastasis

how_to_use.use_case_en: Patients with breast cancer who have had biopsy.
how_to_use.pearls_pitfalls_en:
• The tumor node metastasis (TNM) system stages breast cancer and prognosticates outcome of patients.
  • The staging system is frequently updated in response to new technologies and treatments.
how_to_use.why_use_en: The TNM system is the standard staging system used by oncologists to both prognosticate and communicate clearly about patients.

next_steps.advice_en: Use the TNM system once breast cancer diagnosis is biopsy confirmed.

about.formula_en: Refer to tables in AJCC Staging Manual 2017, pg 38-39.
about.more_info_en: Refer to tables in AJCC Staging Manual 2017, pg 40-46.

Original/Primary Reference.text: American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC). AJCC Cancer Staging Manual. 8th ed. New York: Springer; 2017.

creator_info.about_en: Armando Giuliano, MD, is a clinician and investigator appointed as the Linda and Jim Lippman Chair in surgical oncology. He is also co-director of the Saul and Joyce Brandyman Breast Center at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center. Dr. Giuliano’s primary research is focused on treatment of breast cancer.
